reviewText: BUYERS BEWARE: I should start off by warning you that that there are 2 different versions of this DVD available. One of them has been censored (unfortunately this is the version I purchased) They both appear to have exactly the same content but If you think you might get annoyed (as I did) by Chad Kroeger being continually beeped as he talks to the audience or during some of his song lyrics then you might want to bear this in mind. Also, (although this didn't bother me as much) the audience is having quite a good time and there are several shots of topless babes showing Nickelback their `goods' as they sing and dance along, they have all been blacked out in the censored version.*The uncensored version says on the front cover, in black box  Explicit content.Now about the DVD. If you're a Nickelback fan than you'll love this, it's a great bleeping show and Chad and the boys are having almost as much fun as the bleeping audience. Filmed in Sturgis in front of 35,000 screaming, half naked, mostly female fans, I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this. It's just a great hard rocking show, featuring 12 of the bands major hits. The sound and camera work are flawless with super close ups of the boys and the pyrotechnics are awesome. I can only imagine what they were like live if they looked this good on DVD. A couple of songs that stood out for me were; Woke up this morning and Side of a bullet, culminating with an amazing performance of Figured you out. The concert only runs about an hour but it's a really good hour.The 12 songs covered  are; Animals, Woke up this morning, Photograph, Because of you, Far away, Never again, Savin' me, Someday, Side of a bullet, How you remind me, Too bad and  Figured you out.Some extras have also been included with a behind the scenes look at Nickelback feature, photo gallery, Sturgis 101 vignette and the Rockstar Video.I highly recommend NB Live at Sturgis, I just wish someone could have bleeping warned me about the censorship thing before I bought my version.
summary: SHORT BUT SUUWEEEEET SHOW CENSORED (OR NOT)

reviewText: The GoodNickelback has continuously been trying to shed their sensitive and geeky image by interjecting songs about sex and debauchery into their set list of predominately heartfelt and emotional mega-hits. You hear it album after album. That's not necessarily a bad thing. No matter what Nickelback is singing about, it's still great music. However, compared to their hit singles, the songs about sexual activities make you laugh, rather than shock you. So what better place to shed that geeky image than at the annual Sturgis Bike Rally, right? More on that later...Nickelback always puts on a good show, whether their headlining or not. The Sturgis festival show is no different. From stem to stern Nickelback hits you with twelve tracks of their biggest and most well-known hits. The show is well shot. The crowd is definitely into it. The sound quality is superb. Since the show is from 2006, the band delivers a heavy chuck of material from their album All the Right Reasons. Die-hard fans get an extra special treat with a medley from the group's first album Curb.The bonus material is your typical filler; photo gallery, documentary, music video. The behind-the-scene documentary actually wasn't that bad, and the music video for "Rock Star" was quite enjoyable with its guest celebrities.The BadThis DVD is censored! What is the point of having a show at Sturgis, one of the most outrageous events in the country, if your going to censor the event? Way to brush off that squeaky-clean image Nickelback. That doesn't just go for the footage, it goes for the music and the interview. That's right, the interview is bleeped. Sad.The VerdictGreat show, but the censorship is a joke. This is a DVD release. There's no reason to censor it. It's not like they're censoring the big no-no's. It's the little things that we all use in everyday language. Lame. I also just learned they're putting out a 2-DVD version next month. What was the point of the 1-DVD version?
summary: Great show, but the censorship is a joke.

reviewText: I was really excited to finally pick up a Nickelback live dvd with 90% of their hits on it. My only complaint about the music itself is that all of their hits weren't included, but was a good effort nonetheless. I would have liked if Rock Star and If Everyone Cared were included, but this dvd is great even without them. My main complaint is that the whole dvd is censored. I realize that it's filmed in Sturgis in the middle of bike week, and there are a lot of women topless in the crowd. I can deal with them censoring that, but every time Chad Kroeger swears on stage whether it be in the middle of the song NEVER AGAIN, or just when he tries pumping up the crowd in between songs. I've bought 80's music videos on vhs where all the swears were intact. A home video means it's in your home, so there's no need to censor it. I can understand them censoring it if it's being played on TV, but it's a HOME VIDEO! This is in extremely poor taste by whoever put out this dvd.I know when they released the first video collection, which I also own, they censored NEVER AGAIN, which was in poor taste also. I think whoever puts out these dvds need to wake up because I am not going to recommend this dvd to anyone, unless they like things massacred with stupid edits and takes away from the LIVE experience that IS Nickelback. I give the music on here a 50 stars out of 5, but this dvd release really makes it hard to swallow. So maybe if nobody buys this garbage release, the record company will wake up and re-release it uncensored.I am very disappointed with this dvd release, and am going to be very careful when buying further Nickelback dvds in the future, which is sad because I love the band.
summary: 5 stars For The Music...1 Star For The DVD!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this blu-ray from Amazon and it is not censored.  So while my blu-ray is definitely uncensored, it seems that the DVD has two versions, one uncensored and one censored.Anyway, I think the concert was great.  I saw a few women without their tops, but it was no big deal.  It's the equivalent of a National Geographic magazine about native peoples.  You see pictures of native women in Africa or on the Pacific islands, and they are dancing without wearing anything on top.  It's the same thing in the upper Great Plains of America, you're just watching a few native women dancing without wearing anything on top.  It's nothing to get excited or all riled about.  They are just mostly background shots of people dancing and having fun and there are only a very few images.  I don't recall any suggestiveness beyond dancing and moving to the music.I liked "Far Away" and "Photograph".  As I was working on this review the song "Photograph" came on the radio.  This is a really cool song.  On the concert, images of people brought forth memories from the band's past.What I could do without, though, was a few of the expletives coming from the mouth of Nickelback.  Just sing the songs please.If you are a Nickelback fan, get this concert. It's quite enjoyable to watch this young group play.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sorry, but some fault lies with Nickelback on this - to say that this concert video was long-awaited is an understatement, selling the butchered version exclusively smacks of appreciating all the fools that got this as a gift, didn't realize it would -BE- censored, etc. having to buy a Second copy... sad.  Is is pretty safe to say that Wally might not have sold as many copies of their handiwork if the real item was available for sale?  That's ok, though, we are stupid, have short memories, you name it, you know you will get away with this without having to apologize for be-otch-slapping your fans.Additionally, as an old-school Live Performance buyer, what Phargn Bean Counter was allowed to decide that a concert video is -Now- 61 minutes?  I heard about -one- nickelback concert where two band members were Sick, so they could only play 100 minutes.  Leave it to RIAA/Hollywood "I hate the customers" types to decide that the full concert is too much value for the price.I can only hope that Nickelback reads these reviews - this was a FANTASTIC ~1/2-of-a-concert that they allowed to be butchered, IMHO.Hope you make tons on the pre-planned retrospective collections that will include all the content you've been schooled to HIDE -- too bad no one will care when you finally get 'round to releasing it.(do I sound bitter?)

reviewText: Many of you have complained about this dvd being censored. Welcome to the world of WalMart and Target who choose to do things such as this, and take the word "porno" out of dvd's. This is what happens when society places the responsibility of teaching morals and values on corporations and government rather than taking these responsibilities on themselves.Thankfully, only a limited number of these dvd's were made for Walmart, and the rest (after March 10th I believe) are 100% uncensored. You want swearing, you got it. You want females topless, you got it!WalMart has no place censoring things, BUT they are the world's largest distributor, and they place ridiculous demands such as this.  Thankfully, the band realizes that their true fans want to see TRULY uncensored material! This dvd IS truly uncensored, like you'll never see @ WalMart!
